intro: Dictyodroma basipinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-pinnate sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. Native to coastal regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. Its unique morphology helps it withstand harsh maritime conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. The plant plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
